docs.lead_paragraph: A New York State judge ruled yesterday that a state program to provide prenatal care for the working poor was unconstitutional because it did not include abortion services. The judge, Justice Carmen Ciparick of State Supreme Court in Manhattan, ruled that the exclusion violated state constitutional guarantees of due process, privacy and equal protection.

headline.main: New York Judge Rejects State Prenatal Program That Excludes Abortion
